docs.description: Indexes. BEA's national economic statistics provide a comprehensive view of U.S. production, consumption, investment, exports and imports, and income and saving. These statistics are best known by summary measures such as gross domestic product (GDP), corporate profits, personal income and spending, and personal saving.

docs.name: Population - Male / Age 62 / Urban Areas - Tunisia
docs.description: The United Nations Demographic Yearbook collects, compiles and disseminates official statistics on a wide range of topics. Data have been collected from national statistical authorities since 1948 through a set of questionnaires dispatched annually by the United Nations Statistics Division to over 230 national statistical offices. The Demographic Yearbook disseminates statistics on population size and composition, births, deaths, marriage and divorce on an annual basis. Demographic Yearbook special topics issues cover a wide range of additional topics including economic activity, educational attainment, household characteristics, housing, ethnicity and language, among others.

docs.name: Commodity Imports - Nuclear Reactors, Boilers, Machinery, Etc / Machines for making paper/board bags, sacks, envelope - Guinea
docs.description: The United Nations Commodity Trade Statistics Database (UN Comtrade) stores more than 1 billion trade data records from 1962. Over 140 reporter countries provide the United Nations Statistics Division with their annual international trade statistics detailed by commodities and partner countries. These data are subsequently transformed into the United Nations Statistics Division standard format with consistent coding and valuation using the UN/OECD CoprA internal processing system.

docs.description: The UIS Data Centre contains indicators and raw data on education, literacy, science, culture and communication. The UIS collects these data from more than 200 countries and international organizations. docs.name: Consumption of certain foodstuffs per inhabitant  : Meat : Poultry (kg/head) : Czech Republic
docs.description:
The tables included in the subdomain 'Food consumption' (food_ch) contain information on the gross human apparent consumption of main food items, including data per capita.
- Table Food_ch_cons: Gross human apparent consumption of main food items
- Tabe Food_ch_concap: Gross human apparent consumption of main food items per capita
 The data are derived data from existing tables of the database on the Eurostat website.
For further information, please refer to the ESMS files linked to the original tables (see 21.2 'Related Metadata') following the different food items:
 1.   For the food items 'Cereals', 'Dried pulses', 'Potatoes', 'Rice', 'Sugar', 'Fats and oils', 'Fruit and vegetables', 'Wine':   see 'Crops products: Supply balance sheets':    apro_cpb_esms 
 2.   For the food item 'Eggs' :    see 'Poultry farming':    apro_ec_esms
 3.   For the food items 'Drinking milk', 'Cheese', 'Butter': 
      see 'Milk and milk products':    apro_mk_esms
Full metadata at: http://epp.eurostat.ec.europa.eu/cache/ITY_SDDS/EN/food_ch_esms.htm

sources.description: The United Nations (UN) is an intergovernmental organization established on 24 October 1945 to promote international co-operation.
sources.name: United Nations

sources.description:
Eurostat's mission: to be the leading provider of high quality statistics on Europe. 

Eurostat is the statistical office of the European Union situated in Luxembourg. Its task is to provide the European Union with statistics at European level that enable comparisons between countries and regions.
sources.name: EuroStat

sources.description:
The Securities and Exchange commission is an agency of the United States government.


Their purpose is to regulate stock markets, and in doing so collect and distribute data on all publicly listed companies.
sources.name: U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission

sources.description: The official organisation in Spain that collects statistics about demography, economy, and Spanish society. It is an autonomous organization in Spain responsible for overall coordination of statistical services of the General State Administration in monitoring, control and supervision of technical procedures. (Wikipedia)
sources.name: National Statistics Institute of Spain
